page.title: 09CHURCHES
page.content: Churches Saint Mary's Church in the parish of Basing,lies to the N.W. of the village. It was originally built of flint, known locally as 'Hampshire Diamonds'.The walls have been rebuilt of mostly red narrow brick, after the Civil War.The oldest existing parts of the church are the Norman Arches of the tower on the north and south sides and parts of the north wall of the chancel. During the Civil War all but one of the statues were smashed by the Roundheads.The surviving statue of The Virgin Mary had been concealed by ivy. In the churchyard some of the gravestones have skulls engraved on them to mark possible victims of 'The Plague'. There are no other churches in the block.
